plants.name: Corylopsis spicata
plants.description: A deciduous shrub known for its fragrant, pale yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring before the leaves fully appear. It is native to Japan and thrives in temperate climates.
plants.funFact: Spike Winterhazel flowers produce a pleasant fragrance that attracts early pollinators.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia famous for its large, showy, cup-shaped flowers ranging from white to pink and purple hues. It blooms in early to mid-spring, often before the leaves emerge, heralding the start of the growing season.
plants.location: Native to China, widely cultivated in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Magnolia flowers appeared on earth before bees evolved, and are primarily pollinated by beetles.

plants.name: Lupinus texensis
plants.description: A wildflower and the state flower of Texas, it produces vibrant blue to purple pea-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, carpeting fields and roadsides.
plants.funFact: Bluebonnets fix nitrogen in the soil, improving fertility for other plants.

plants.name: Daphne odora
plants.description: An evergreen shrub valued for its highly fragrant pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Native to China and Japan, it's often grown as an ornamental in mild climates.
plants.location: East Asia and cultivated gardens in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Daphne odora's fragrance is so strong that it can be detected from several meters away.
